snippet: The arrest and 18-month imprisonment of Jacob Ostreicher has turned into an international affair that has drawn the attention of the State Department and the actor-director Sean Penn.
abstract: Arrest and 18-month imprisonment of Jacob Ostreicher, American entrepreneur who became a rice farmer in Bolivia, on charges of laundering drug money has become a far-reaching international affair; Ostreicher, who denies charges, is under house arrest after being freed from prison following hunger strike and intervention of actor Sean Penn; several Bolivian officials were arrested for attempting to extort Ostreicher's assets.

byline.contributor: A correspondent for The New York Times contributed reporting from Bolivia.

lead_paragraph: The arrest and 18-month imprisonment of Jacob Ostreicher has turned into an international affair that has drawn the attention of the State Department and the actor-director Sean Penn.

headline.seo: From Brooklyn to Bolivian Rice Venture, Prison and Sean Penn’s Help
headline.main: For Brooklyn Entrepreneur, Bolivian Jail and an Actor’s Aid
